title: Hezbollah says it will escalate war with Israel after Hamas leader killed
content: Hezbollah declares a new phase against Israel following the killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar. Western leaders view his death as a chance to end the Gaza conflict, but Israel vows to continue until hostages are freed. Iran and Hezbollah remain defiant.
summary: Hezbollah declares a new phase against Israel following the killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar. Western leaders view his death as a chance to end the Gaza conflict, but Israel vows to continue until hostages are freed. Iran and Hezbollah remain defiant.

title: North Korean leader stresses troops to treat South Korea as hostile foreign enemy
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un urged his troops to view South Korea as a hostile enemy and asserted that any South Korean violations of North Korean sovereignty would be met with force. This follows North Korea's constitutional revision defining South Korea as a hostile state and the destruction of road and rail links to the South.
summary: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un urged his troops to view South Korea as a hostile enemy and asserted that any South Korean violations of North Korean sovereignty would be met with force. This follows North Korea's constitutional revision defining South Korea as a hostile state and the destruction of road and rail links to the South.

title: 'We are all on the same team now': Senate minority leader Mitch McConnell defends past remarks on Donald Trump
content: Mitch McConnell addressed his past private remarks criticizing Donald Trump, clarifying his stance as part of a team with other Republicans. His comments, recently disclosed in an upcoming biography, highlight past tensions around the January 6 Capitol attack and the 2020 election results.
summary: Mitch McConnell addressed his past private remarks criticizing Donald Trump, clarifying his stance as part of a team with other Republicans. His comments, recently disclosed in an upcoming biography, highlight past tensions around the January 6 Capitol attack and the 2020 election results.

title: 'Fantastically attractive' Trump compliments female senator during women-only town hall event; says explained IVF to him
content: Former President Donald Trump faced backlash for describing Republican Senator Katie Britt as "young" and "fantastically attractive" during a Fox News town hall. Critics called his remarks misogynistic and irrelevant to the key issues of abortion and IVF access being debated in Alabama.
summary: Former President Donald Trump faced backlash for describing Republican Senator Katie Britt as "young" and "fantastically attractive" during a Fox News town hall. Critics called his remarks misogynistic and irrelevant to the key issues of abortion and IVF access being debated in Alabama.

title: 'Settled its account ... ': Israeli PM Netanyahu on Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar's killing
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu confirmed the killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, held responsible for the October 7 massacre. Netanyahu emphasized the mission's continued priority of rescuing hostages. U.S. President Biden praised the action, recognizing Sinwar's elimination as significant for global security.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu confirmed the killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, held responsible for the October 7 massacre. Netanyahu emphasized the mission's continued priority of rescuing hostages. U.S. President Biden praised the action, recognizing Sinwar's elimination as significant for global security.

title: US stealth bombers target underground bunkers of Houthis in Yemen
content: The US deployed B-2 stealth bombers to hit underground bunkers used by Yemen's Houthi rebels, marking a significant escalation. Labeling it as a unique demonstration of targeting capabilities, US officials indirectly warned Iran. The strikes aimed at disrupting the rebels' control in Yemen, with reports of air raids around Sanaa and Saada but no immediate casualty details.
summary: The US deployed B-2 stealth bombers to hit underground bunkers used by Yemen's Houthi rebels, marking a significant escalation. Labeling it as a unique demonstration of targeting capabilities, US officials indirectly warned Iran. The strikes aimed at disrupting the rebels' control in Yemen, with reports of air raids around Sanaa and Saada but no immediate casualty details.

title: Dhaka to take steps to bring Hasina back, says top official
content: Bangladesh’s International Crimes Tribunal has issued arrest warrants for former PM Sheikh Hasina and 45 others on genocide and crimes against humanity charges. She fled to India, and calls for her extradition have intensified, backed by the extradition treaty between the two nations.
summary: Bangladesh’s International Crimes Tribunal has issued arrest warrants for former PM Sheikh Hasina and 45 others on genocide and crimes against humanity charges. She fled to India, and calls for her extradition have intensified, backed by the extradition treaty between the two nations.

title: Jimmy Carter, at age 100, casts his ballot by mail
MAGA supporter questions Vivek Ramaswamy's Hindu faith: Check out his answer
content: Republican leader Vivek Ramaswamy confronted questions about his faith at a campaign event, defending his transparency and rejecting accusations of misleading his audience. He highlighted his Hindu beliefs and referenced Thomas Jefferson, addressing the broader issue of religious diversity in American leadership.
summary: Republican leader Vivek Ramaswamy confronted questions about his faith at a campaign event, defending his transparency and rejecting accusations of misleading his audience. He highlighted his Hindu beliefs and referenced Thomas Jefferson, addressing the broader issue of religious diversity in American leadership.

title: Who was Hamas leader and Oct 7 mastermind Yahya Sinwar killed by IDF
content: The Israel Defense Forces have eliminated Yahya Sinwar, the mastermind behind the October 7 attack that resulted in the deaths of approximately 1,200 Israelis and ignited a conflict killing over 42,000 Palestinians. Sinwar, a leading Hamas figure, was involved in planning the assault alongside Mohammed Deif.
summary: The Israel Defense Forces have eliminated Yahya Sinwar, the mastermind behind the October 7 attack that resulted in the deaths of approximately 1,200 Israelis and ignited a conflict killing over 42,000 Palestinians. Sinwar, a leading Hamas figure, was involved in planning the assault alongside Mohammed Deif.

title: Was Kamala cooked during her Fox interview? Here is what people on X are saying
content: Social media is abuzz with mixed reactions to Vice President Kamala Harris' interview with Bret Baier on Fox Network. Critics labeled it a "disaster" while supporters praised her confidence. Key topics included border security, attacks on Trump, and her stance on transgender inmate policies. The interview has ignited another debate on X.
summary: Social media is abuzz with mixed reactions to Vice President Kamala Harris' interview with Bret Baier on Fox Network. Critics labeled it a "disaster" while supporters praised her confidence. Key topics included border security, attacks on Trump, and her stance on transgender inmate policies. The interview has ignited another debate on X.

title: 'Day of love': Trump downplays his role in January 6 Capital riots
content: During a Univision town hall, Donald Trump faced tough questions about his actions during the January 6 riot and the Covid-19 pandemic. He distanced himself from the Capitol attack, labeling it a 'day of love' and refuted claims of gun presence. Trump reaffirmed his intention to pardon most January 6 rioters if re-elected.
summary: During a Univision town hall, Donald Trump faced tough questions about his actions during the January 6 riot and the Covid-19 pandemic. He distanced himself from the Capitol attack, labeling it a 'day of love' and refuted claims of gun presence. Trump reaffirmed his intention to pardon most January 6 rioters if re-elected.

title: 'Trump did not lose 2020 election': JD Vance
content: JD Vance, Republican vice-presidential candidate, avoided directly acknowledging Trump's 2020 election loss, hinting at issues with the election process instead. At a campaign event, he mentioned concerns over big tech censorship influencing results. Despite no evidence of widespread voter fraud, Trump and many supporters continue to dispute the election outcome, leading to significant legal consequences.
summary: JD Vance, Republican vice-presidential candidate, avoided directly acknowledging Trump's 2020 election loss, hinting at issues with the election process instead. At a campaign event, he mentioned concerns over big tech censorship influencing results. Despite no evidence of widespread voter fraud, Trump and many supporters continue to dispute the election outcome, leading to significant legal consequences.

title: Ashley Parham $50m lawsuit: Diddy accused of gangrape following Tupac murder allegations
content: Ashley Parham has accused rapper Sean 'Diddy' Combs of gang rape related to comments about the murder of Tupac Shakur. Parham seeks $50 million in damages, alleging a 2018 assault involving drugs and threats. Combs remains in custody on multiple charges, including sex trafficking, with his trial set for May 2025.
summary: Ashley Parham has accused rapper Sean 'Diddy' Combs of gang rape related to comments about the murder of Tupac Shakur. Parham seeks $50 million in damages, alleging a 2018 assault involving drugs and threats. Combs remains in custody on multiple charges, including sex trafficking, with his trial set for May 2025.

title: 'Secret service needs reform': Probe panel on Trump's assassination attempt
content: An independent panel criticized the Secret Service for failures during the attempted assassination of Donald Trump at a July 13 rally in Pennsylvania. The panel's report identified security lapses and complacency among agents. Recommendations included better training and leadership programs. The gunman, Thomas Crooks, fired at Trump, grazing his ear and killing a man in the crowd.
summary: An independent panel criticized the Secret Service for failures during the attempted assassination of Donald Trump at a July 13 rally in Pennsylvania. The panel's report identified security lapses and complacency among agents. Recommendations included better training and leadership programs. The gunman, Thomas Crooks, fired at Trump, grazing his ear and killing a man in the crowd.

title: US says it is 'satisfied' with India's cooperation in alleged plot to kill Pannun
content: The Biden administration is cooperating with New Delhi in investigating a foiled plot to assassinate Khalistani separatist Gurpatwant Pannun. India has informed the US that the implicated official is no longer employed by the Indian Government. Pannun's activities have raised tensions between India, the US, and Canada due to political freedom and security concerns.
summary: The Biden administration is cooperating with New Delhi in investigating a foiled plot to assassinate Khalistani separatist Gurpatwant Pannun. India has informed the US that the implicated official is no longer employed by the Indian Government. Pannun's activities have raised tensions between India, the US, and Canada due to political freedom and security concerns.

title: 1,100 mpox deaths recorded across Africa: CDC
content: Some 1,100 people across Africa have died from mpox, the African Union's health agency said Thursday, warning that the epidemic was "going out of control" without further action. "Mpox is going out of control if we don't act," Africa CDC head Jean Kaseya told an online media briefing.
summary: Some 1,100 people across Africa have died from mpox, the African Union's health agency said Thursday, warning that the epidemic was "going out of control" without further action. "Mpox is going out of control if we don't act," Africa CDC head Jean Kaseya told an online media briefing.

title: The next Pakistan? How Trudeau’s 'pro-Khalistan stance' puts Canada at risk
content: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau faces mounting pressure to resign due to his perceived mishandling of Khalistani separatism, especially amidst worsening diplomatic relations with India. Experts warn Canada risks a scenario similar to Pakistan's history with extremist factions. Rising discontent within Trudeau's own Liberal party adds to the gravity of his political predicament.
summary: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau faces mounting pressure to resign due to his perceived mishandling of Khalistani separatism, especially amidst worsening diplomatic relations with India. Experts warn Canada risks a scenario similar to Pakistan's history with extremist factions. Rising discontent within Trudeau's own Liberal party adds to the gravity of his political predicament.

title: Former New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern honored as Dame Grand Companion by Prince William
content: Former New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern is honored as a Dame Grand Companion of the New Zealand Order of Merit by Prince William at Windsor Castle for her service to the state. Ardern expressed her gratitude and reflected on her leadership, particularly through crises like the Christchurch mosque shootings and COVID-19 pandemic.
summary: Former New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern is honored as a Dame Grand Companion of the New Zealand Order of Merit by Prince William at Windsor Castle for her service to the state. Ardern expressed her gratitude and reflected on her leadership, particularly through crises like the Christchurch mosque shootings and COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Bangladesh court issues arrest warrant for ex-PM Sheikh Hasina
content: A Bangladeshi court has issued an arrest warrant for former prime minister Sheikh Hasina, who has been in exile in India since August. Hasina faces accusations of severe human rights abuses during her 15-year rule, which include political detentions and extrajudicial killings. The extradition remains uncertain due to its political nature.
summary: A Bangladeshi court has issued an arrest warrant for former prime minister Sheikh Hasina, who has been in exile in India since August. Hasina faces accusations of severe human rights abuses during her 15-year rule, which include political detentions and extrajudicial killings. The extradition remains uncertain due to its political nature.
